page.title: 17INTERVIEW WITH LOCAL MAN
page.content: We received this interesting information from Mr P E Jelks of Havant,who has lived in this area since he was 3 years old. The main occupations of the people of Havant, Leigh Park, many years ago were as farmers ,gamekeepers,servants and kennel keepers on the local estates.Leigh Park Estate was named after Leigh Park House which is no there,and most of Leigh Park fifty years ago was woodland and pasture areas. During and after the Second World War the population of Havant increased dramatically,due to the fact that other areas in Portsmouth were evacuated because of major bombing. Idsworth House and Estate now is the image of what Leigh Park was like before the housing estate was built. by Andrea Summers & Nigel Hindmarsh.
